entry.string: The Authsystem is the default Authentication module and part of the Xaraya Core package. It handles user authentication on your site by checking for a valid user log in.

The Authsystem module is installed as part of the Core installation package and comes ready activated for your use. Once Xaraya is installed you should go to Admin Panel - Authentication - Modify Config to confirm setup of the Authentication options.
Short URLs : There is short URL support that you can configure in the Admin Modify Config menu option
Login Security Options : can also be configured and currently include login attempts and lockout time.

NOTE: If you also require the ability to have users register and log in on your site, you should install the Registration module. The Registration module manages user registration and options for that process (which was previously handled by Roles module in earlier Xaraya versions). It is available in the Xaraya Base distribution and Module code repository
The Roles module will use the default Login page and block of the Default Authentication module wish is by default, Authsystem.

Xaraya also has the ability to add other types of Authentication modules such as AuthLDAP, AuthURL, AuthEmail and so on, that are available in our 3rd party module code repository in addition to 3rd party providers' sites. Please see the documentation for the relevant authentication module.
In the case of authentication modules other than the default, you should set your Default Authentication module for Roles in the Roles module Modify Config.
